question_sentence: What resort town in the Canadian Rockies hosted world leaders for the 51st G7 summit?
evidence: Despite – or perhaps because of – the Albertan mountain town's low profile, this was the second time Kananaskis has hosted a G7 conference. The Kananaskis Village resort, around 50 miles west of Calgary, was also the setting for the 28th summit of what was then the G8, back in 2002.

question_sentence: Opponents of Donald Trump turned out across the US for protests under what name?
evidence: Millions of people across the US took to the streets to protest the Trump administration's mass deportations. The American Civil Liberties Union estimated that more than 5 million participants gathered at more than 2,100 sites nationwide.

question_sentence: Blaise Metreweli has become the first female chief of what intelligence agency?
evidence: Metreweli, currently head of technology at the UK's foreign intelligence service, will take over as its chief – or "C" – when current boss Richard Moore steps down in the autumn after a five-year term. A Cambridge graduate with a 26-year career in intelligence, she had been considered "the internal frontrunner for several years", said The Times.

question_sentence: What is the name of the volcano that erupted in Indonesia?
evidence: Flights to and from Bali were cancelled after Mount Lewotobi Laki-Laki, a twin-peaked volcano near the island of Flores, erupted on Tuesday. Officials raised the disaster alert to the highest level as ash clouds covered the area.

question_sentence: Which Italian football team visited the Oval Office?
evidence: In a surreal scene, Donald Trump mused over the possibility of US strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities as players in their Juventus hoodies stood motionless behind him. He later asked general manager Damien Comolli if the Italian club would allow a woman to play in the men's team, in reference to the ongoing row over transgender people in sport.

question_sentence: Seven men have been charged over the "largest jewellery heist in US history" in which city?
evidence: Federal prosecutors have charged seven men in connection with the July 2022 heist. The men are estimated to have stolen $100 million (£75 million) worth of gold, diamonds, rubies, emeralds and luxury watches. Two suspects were arrested on Monday, one is currently jailed in Arizona for an unrelated burglary, and the other four remain at large.

question_sentence: A lucky punter from which country has won the largest possible Euromillions lottery jackpot?
evidence: The winner, an unidentified man from Munster, becomes only the second person to receive the lottery's maximum possible payout – €250 million (£213 million) – less than three months after the jackpot was won by a ticket-holder in Austria. If there is no winner after five draws at the €250 million maximum, the prize money is split between lower-tier winners.

question_sentence: Which team won ice hockey's Stanley Cup?
evidence: The Florida Panthers won the Stanley Cup after defeating the Edmonton Oilers 5-1 in Game 6 of the NHL Finals. The Panthers' victory not only secures the team's second Stanley Cup title but also makes it the 10th franchise to win back-to-back championships.

question_sentence: Which West End show has attracted controversy because its most famous song is performed outside the theatre?
evidence: Jamie Lloyd's new staging of Andrew Lloyd Webber's musical has star Rachel Zegler emerge on to the balcony of the London Palladium to perform her show-stopping "Don't Cry For Me Argentina". While some have praised the decision as a creative twist, others have complained that it cheats theatregoers of the show's most famous number.

question_sentence: Plans were unveiled for what artwork to get its own dedicated gallery?
evidence: The plans will see the "Mona Lisa" relocated to a new exhibition within the Louvre in Paris. Visitors will need to pay an additional fee to see Leonardo da Vinci's artwork, on top of the standard admission ticket. The renovation project is expected to cost the museum €800 million (£680 million).

question_sentence: The largest manhunt in which state’s history ended last weekend with the arrest of shooting suspect Vance Boelter?
evidence: Boelter was captured roughly two days after he allegedly shot and killed Minnesota State Rep. Melissa Hortman and her husband, Mark. He also allegedly shot State Sen. John Hoffman and his wife, Yvette, both of whom survived.

question_sentence: The Senate recently voted to advance the GENIUS Act, a bill that aims to create a framework for regulating which of the following?
evidence: The legislation would regulate “stablecoins,” a cryptocurrency that is tied to the value of the US dollar.

question_sentence: Which ally of President Donald Trump was found guilty this week of defaming a former employee of a leading voting equipment company after the 2020 presidential election?
evidence: A jury awarded former Dominion Voting Systems security and product strategy director Eric Coomer $2.3 million in damages after MyPillow founder Mike Lindell falsely accused him of stealing the 2020 election.

question_sentence: What legendary intelligence service will be led by a woman for the first time?
evidence: Blaise Metreweli will become chief of Britain’s foreign intelligence service (MI6) this fall.

question_sentence: Which of the following took the number one spot on the ranking of the world’s most livable cities for 2025, according to an annual list from the Economist Intelligence Unit?
evidence: Copenhagen, Denmark’s capital, topped the list after receiving “perfect” scores for stability, education and infrastructure.

question_sentence: Seven people have been charged with involvement in an operation described by officials as “the largest jewelry heist in history.” What did they steal?
evidence: The massive theft of gold, watches, gems and jewelry was worth an estimated $100 million.

question_sentence: Which volcano erupted this week, sending an enormous ash column into the sky?
evidence: Mount Lewotobi Laki Laki’s eruption caused the delay or cancellation of dozens of flights to and from the island of Bali.

question_sentence: Which of the following prominent UK figures was not awarded a knighthood in this year’s King’s Birthday Honours list?
evidence: Sorry, Harry. There’s always next year.

question_sentence: Which hockey team won the Stanley Cup Final this week?
evidence: The Florida Panthers conquered the Edmonton Oilers and lifted the Stanley Cup as kings of the NHL — for the second year in a row!

question_sentence: Who is taking over the lead role in the Broadway show, “Oh, Mary!”?
evidence: Monsoon, who won “RuPaul’s Drag Race” and “RuPaul’s Drag Race All Stars,” will take over the role from Cole Escola, who won a Tony Award for the part.
